abstract.p: Sarah Willeman wins United States Equestrian Team's young rider championship (S)

block.p: Sarah Willeman of Hamilton, Mass., scored 362 points in a four-rider showdown to win the United States Equestrian Team's young rider championship, the first leg of the equitation triple crown, yesterday in Gladstone, N.J.

Willeman, an 18-year-old freshman at Stanford, and her mount, Grappa, emerged on top in a field of 63 qualifiers in the four-phase competition over three days. Four riders and horses qualified for the showdown, in which each competitor rode over a jumper-style course of obstacles on her own horse and then repeated the ride on each of the other contestants' horses.
